pullRequest.title: [DOCS] Clarifying remote clusters based on feedback from Support
pullRequest.bodyText:
The current page for Remote clusters is confusing to navigate and has prompted questions. This PR seeks to streamline that page and provide some clarity in navigation, organization, and content.
Updated remote clusters page for this PR
Backports:

7.x #62394
7.9 #62395
7.8  #62396

commit.message: Clarifying remote clusters based on feedback from Support.

nodes.bodyText:
I'd unpack this a little bit. Maybe something like:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Set up _remote clusters_ to establish unidirectional
          
          
            
            connections required for
          
          
            
            <<xpack-ccr,{ccr}>> and <<modules-cross-cluster-search,{ccs}>>.
          
          
            
            You can connect a local cluster to other {es} clusters, known as _remote
          
          
            
            clusters_. Once connected, you can search remote clusters using
          
          
            
            <<modules-cross-cluster-search,{ccs}>>. You can also sync data between clusters
          
          
            
            using <<xpack-ccr,{ccr}>>.

nodes.bodyText:
I'd say "register" the remote cluster rather than "create" or "configure":

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            You configure a remote cluster and connect
          
          
            
            to a limited number of nodes in that remote cluster using either
          
          
            
            <<sniff-mode,sniff mode>> or <<proxy-mode,proxy mode>>.
          
          
            
            To register a remote cluster, the local cluster must connect to  nodes in the
          
          
            
            remote cluster. You can do this using one of two connection modes:
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            * <<sniff-mode,sniff mode>>
          
          
            
            * <<proxy-mode,proxy mode>>

nodes.bodyText:
The imperative reads oddly to me here. I also don't think the clause about remote nodes is needed.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Use the <<cluster-remote-info, remote cluster info API>> to retrieve
          
          
            
            information about the configured remote clusters, as well as the remote nodes
          
          
            
            that the node is connected to.
          
          
            
            You can use the <<cluster-remote-info, remote cluster info API>> to get
          
          
            
            information about registered remote clusters.
